title-part.text: AERIALS

reference.text: microwave radiators for near-field therepeutic treatment A61N5/04 ; apparatus for testing aerials or for measuring aerial characteristics G01R; waveguides H01P; radiators or aerials for microwave heating H05B6/72

note.note-paragraph:
This subclass covers:
- in addition to the primary active radiating elements,
a) secondary devices for absorbing or for modifying the
direction or polarisation of waves radiated from aerials,
and
b) combinations with auxiliary devices such as earthing
switches, lead-in devices, and lightning protectors;
- both transmitting and receiving aerials
This subclass does not cover devices of the waveguide type, such as resonators or lines, not designed as radiating elements, which are covered by subclass H01P.

In this subclass, the following expression is used with the meaning indicated:
- "active radiating element" covers corresponding parts of a
receiving aerial.

The following IPC groups are not used in the CPC scheme. Subject matter covered by these groups is classified in the following CPC groups : - H01Q5/01 covered by H01Q5/0003 to H01Q5/0096 - H01Q5/02 covered by H01Q5/0003 to H01Q5/0096 ]

title-part.text: Details of, or arrangements associated with, aerials

reference.text: arrangements for varying orientation of directional pattern H01Q3/00

note.note-paragraph:
This group covers only:
- structural details or features of aerials not dependent on
electric operation;
- structural details or features applicable to more than one
type of aerial or aerial element.
Structural details or features described with reference to, or clearly applicable only to, aerials or aerial elements of a particular type are classified in the group appropriate to that type.

reference.text: ; producing pencil beam by two cylindrical reflectors with their focal lines orthogonally disposed H01Q19/20

title-part.text: wherein the surfaces are plane
comprising one main concave reflecting surface associated with an auxiliary reflecting surface

CPC-specific-text.text: wherein the primary active element uses one or more deflecting surfaces, e.g. beam waveguide feeds
with dual offset reflectors
with feed supported subreflector

title-part.text: wherein a reflecting surface acts also as a polarisation filter or a polarising device
Producing pencil beam by two cylindrical focusing devices with their focal lines orthogonally disposed
using a secondary device in the form of a single substantially straight conductive element
the primary active element being centre-fed and substantially straight, e.g. H-aerial
the primary active element being end-fed and elongated
using a secondary device in the form of two or more substantially straight conductive elements

reference.text: log-periodic aerials H01Q11/10 ; constituting a reflecting surface H01Q19/10

title-part.text: the primary active element being centre-fed and substantially straight, e.g. Yagi-aerial
the primary active element being end-fed and elongated
Aerial arrays or systems

reference.text: producing a beam the orientation or the shape of the directional pattern of which can be changed or varied H01Q3/00 ;

CPC-specific-text.text: combination of imbricated aerials or arrays operating on different wavebands H01Q5/0006

note.note-paragraph:
This group includes:
- arrays comprising two or more individually energised
similar active aerial units spaced apart;
- combinations of different types of active aerials or
arrays;
- combinations of substantially independant non-interacting
active aerials or arrays.

CPC-specific-text.text: Particular feeding systems
Radial guide fed arrays
Space- fed arrays
Modular arrays
Parallel-plate fed arrays; Lens-fed arrays
linear waveguide fed arrays
Slotted waveguides
Slotted waveguides arrays
Conically or cylindrically arrayed
the slots being disposed around the feeding waveguide
Dielectric waveguide fed arrays
Stripline fed arrays
using suspended striplines
Apparatus or processes specially adapted for manufacturing antenna arrays
Monolithic arrays

title-part.text: Arrays of individually energised active aerial units similarly polarised and spaced apart

CPC-specific-text.text: Two dimensional planar arrays
using dipole aerials;
using horn or slot aerials
Patch antenna array
using endfire radiating aerial units transverse to the plane of the array
using parallel coplanar travelling wave or leaky wave aerial units

title-part.text: the units being spaced along or adjacent to a rectilinear path
Collinear arrangements of substantially straight elongated conductive units
Parallel arrangements of substantially straight elongated conductive units

reference.text: travelling-wave aerials comprising transmission line loaded with transverse elements, e.g. "fishbone" aerial H01Q11/04

title-part.text: Adcock aerials
U-type
H-type
the units being spaced along or adjacent to a curvilinear path

CPC-specific-text.text: slotted waveguide arrays H01Q21/005 ; circularly or helically slotted waveguides H01Q21/0062
providing an omnidirectional coverage

title-part.text: Aerial units of the array energised non-uniformly in amplitude or phase, e.g. tapered array, binomial array

CPC-specific-text.text: Finite focus antenna arrays

title-part.text: Combinations of aerial elements or aerial units polarised in different directions for transmitting or receiving circularly and elliptically polarised waves or waves linearly polarised in any direction

reference.text: circularly polarised patch antennas H01Q9/0428 ; circularly polarised horns H01Q13/0241 ; cross-polarised horns H01Q13/0258 ; polarisation converters H01Q15/242 ; cross-polarised rear feeds H01Q19/136 ; crossed polarisation dual antenna H01Q25/001

CPC-specific-text.text: provided with means for varying the polarisation

reference.text: polarising devices H01Q15/24 ; tracking by comparing linear polarisation compounds G01S3/146 ; reducing depolarisation effects H04B7/00 polarisation diversity H04B7/10

title-part.text: Turnstile or like aerials comprising arrangements of three or more elongated elements disposed radially and symmetrically in a horizontal plane about a common centre
Combinations of substantially independent non-interacting aerial units or systems
Combinations of different interacting aerial units for giving a desired directional characteristic

CPC-specific-text.text: one unit or more being an array of identical aerial elements
Multiplicative arrays

title-part.text: Combinations of separate aerial units operating in different wavebands and connected to a common feeder system
Aerials with active circuits or circuit elements integrated within them or attached to them

note.note-paragraph: Group H01Q23/00 includes only such combinations in which the type of aerial or aerial element is immaterial. Combinations with a particular type of aerial are classified in the group appropriate to that type.

title-part.text: Aerials or aerial systems providing at least two radiating patterns

reference.text: arrangements for changing or varying the orientation or the shape of the directional pattern H01Q3/00

providing two or four symmetrical beams for Janus application
providing two patterns of opposite direction; back to back antennas
using two or more primary active elements in the focal region of a focusing device
